p: Fungus . Allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis (ABPA) is a unique form of asthma caused by colonization of the LRT ( Vlahakis and Aksamit, 2001). ABPA is caused by an exaggerated T helper type 2 response to the ubiquitous mold Aspergillus spp., by which colonization leads to allergic and/or asthma symptoms ( Edwards et al., 2012).
